text: The credit company receives the credit information from the customer , If the requested amount is greater than 1M $ an approval must be requested . If the requested amount is lower or equal to 1M $ the company assess the risk of the credit . After the assessment , if the risk is high , an approval must be requested ; but if the risk is low the credit is accepted . After the approval request , the credit could be accepted or rejected ; in both cases , an email is sent to the customer .

the requested amount is greater than 1M $
the requested amount is lower or equal to 1M $
the company assess the risk of the credit
the credit could be accepted or rejected
an email is sent to the customer

text: If a not collected bag is identified , CVS must check the number of resolution retries conducted . If the number of retries is greater than an specified number , the bag must be returned to the production area for disassemble ; in all other cases , CVS must try to contact the customer by phone and remind to pick up the bag . If the contact is successful and the customer withdrawn the order , the bag must be returned to the production area for disassemble , but if it is successful and the customer promises to pick up the bag , CVS must increase the retry count on the bag label . Also , this number must be increased if the contact is unsuccessful .
node_token_list: a not collected bag is identified
CVS must check the number of resolution retries conducted
the number of retries is greater than an specified number
the bag must be returned to the production area for disassemble
CVS must try to contact the customer by phone and remind to pick up the bag
the contact is successful and the customer withdrawn the order
the bag must be returned to the production area for disassemble
it is successful and the customer promises to pick up the bag
CVS must increase the retry count on the bag label

text: As soon as an employee files an expense report the process is started . Once the expense report is received a check is performed to make sure the employee has an account . If this check does not take place within 28 days , the process is stopped and the employee is sent a ' resubmit ' email . When the employee has an account the report is reviewed . If the employee does not have an account , an account is created after which the report is reviewed . A check is performed to see if the amount of the expense exceeds 200 . If it does not exceed 200 , the employee is reimbursed through a deposit directly to the employee 's bank account and the process is ended . In the case that it does exceed 200 , a supervisor is asked for approval . Three things can happen after this . First , the supervisor approves within 7 days , this will result in the deposit of the reimbursement directly to the employee 's bank account . Once this is done the process is ended . Second , the supervisor rejects within 7 days , as a result the employee receives a notification through email that the request has been rejected . Third , if it takes the supervisor more than 7 days to respond , an email is sent to the employee informing him / her that the approval is in progress and the part of the processes after a supervisor is asked for approval is repeated .
node_token_list: an employee files an expense report
a check is performed to make sure the employee has an account

text: At the end of every week , the Payment Office of SSP generates a payment report and then pays the vendor . This payment report is sent automatically to clients ( including the payment invoice ) , also the payment office must send the payment report to both the Registry office and to the Accounts Receivable Department . The Accounts Receivable Department generates the monthly invoice for clients , and then charges $ 35 per invoice notifying the client . The Registry office selects the paper - based invoices that have been paid in order to archive the invoices per vendor and then per payment data ; also , this office tracks down the payment .

The Accounts Receivable Department generates the monthly invoice for clients

text: The process of buying new hardware is started as soon as a request for new hardware is received by the IT department . The next step is for the IT department to analyse the request and either approve or deny it . If it is denied , the employee is informed via email about the denial and the process is ended . However , if the request is approved it is edited and completed . Then an email is sent to the supplier asking about prices . Then the supplier replies to the email by sending an offer for the requested items . Once this offer is received , a form is filled in and sent to the management . The management then analyses the request and decides if it is approved or not . In the former case , the offer is forwarded to the financial department and back to the IT department . The financial department finds resources while the IT department prepares an order and sends this to the supplier . When this is accepted and the financial resources are found the hardware is received by the IT department . After which the financial department will take care of the invoice and the processes is ended . In the scenario where the management does not approve the request it can send the request back to the IT department for rework , then the IT department has to go back to editing and completing a request . If the management does not approve the request it can also decide to deny the request after which the process is ended .

the IT department to analyse the request and either approve or deny it
the employee is informed via email about the denial and the process is ended

text: The process starts with the Provision Team receiving a request from a Customer . First , the team has to identify the necessary parts . If the team has any question about the request , they may ask for more information to the customer . Afterwards , the team needs to check if all parts are available . If available , they are supplied to the customer . Otherwise , the team must record the petition , make an order to Daisuki , and contact the customer once the team collects all parts . After the items are recollected by the customer , the final payment is received .

the items are recollected by the customer

text: The reimbursement process within the ERICS company is started as soon as a reimbursement request is received . After receiving the request a reimbursement contact is created . Afterwards a beneficiary is chosen . Then , a refund period is contract duration is determined . Once this has been completed a check is done to see if a customer is part of a " Verband " or only has normal subsidiaries . In the former case , the customer group association is selected . In the latter case , customers are selected manually . Once either of these two activities have been completed a threshold is set . Once the refund period has ended , a credit note is printed and sent to the customer . In the meanwhile a reimbursement is calculated and paid to the customer . Once the payment has been made and the notification to the customer has been sent , the process ends .
node_token_list: The reimbursement process within the ERICS company is started
a refund period is contract duration is determined
a check is done to see if a customer is part of a " Verband " or only has normal subsidiaries
the customer group association is selected
either of these two activities have been completed
a credit note is printed and sent to the customer
a reimbursement is calculated and paid to the customer
the payment has been made and the notification to the customer has been sent

text: The process starts by reviewing the order . The staff should check if all the requested items are available . If something is missing , the staff has to inform customer about a potential delay and order the missing products . In the exceptional case of a discontinued item , the customer should be informed about the not longer available items . After waiting an average of x days for the delivery , the staff should check again if all products are on store . If everything is OK , then the staff recollects all products and prepare a package . The courier is then informed about the pre-processed package . The courier company informs the client about a potential delay until there are enough human resources to process the delivery . Then , the package is picked up by the designed driver . A centralized service decides the best route to deliver all driver 's packages . Once the driver delivers the package , she should update the system so all stakeholders are notified .

text: The process starts with an informational meeting among the web design team . If this meeting is not successful , the process ends here . otherwise , the team starts by creating a storyboard . After an agreement on the storyboard , part of the team starts working on the design and development of the website . Simultaneously , the team will start to prepare an initial draft of the content . In case a review of the draft is needed , the marketing team will conduct this , before the web design team creates the final version of the content . When the development and content have been completed , the website will be built and reviewed . If the site is approved , the process is completed , otherwise the team goes back to the building step .

text: After management indicates that new clients are needed , the marketing team will perform a market analysis and prepare a portfolio presentation . When they have sent out offers to potential clients the marketing team informs management about the responses . Management then starts negotiations by sending out a detailed offer to the client . If the client accepts the offer , management will prepare a contract that will be signed . Otherwise , management analyzes the reason why their offer failed in order to improve in the future .

the marketing team will perform a market analysis and prepare a portfolio presentation

text: An order to cash process starts when a customer order is received . After the order has been processed , it is send to the warehouse . The warehouse employees determine the parts required to produce the requested items . If any parts are not available in the warehouse , these are ordered . Once all necessary parts are available , production will start . After production , quality checks will be performed . If the production process has finished , products will be packaged and labeled , before returning to the warehouse . Finally , sales will be informed about the completed production and the product can be sold to the customer .
node_token_list: An order to cash process starts
it is send to the warehouse
The warehouse employees determine the parts required to produce the requested items
any parts are not available in the warehouse
products will be packaged and labeled
sales will be informed about the completed production and the product can be sold to the customer

text: A client who wants to create a Paypal account first needs to determine the desired account type . He should either select a personal account or a premium account . Afterwards , the client should enter login details , such as e-mail address and desired password , personal details , such as name and date of birth , as well as his telephone number and address . Finally , the client needs to declare if he has been affiliated with any politically exposed person . When the client clicks the create account button , the details will be sent to the Paypal system . When a request is received , the system will validate the input fields . If there are any invalid fields , the client will be notified and needs to correct them . Otherwise a welcome email will be generated and sent to indicate that an account has been created .

text: The process starts when the IS is notified about a data validation error . The drop - off tech checks for typos . If this is not the case , the technician checks if the customer can correct the mistake . Otherwise , public sources are scoured for solutions . As soon as any check was passed , the issue is considered resolved .

text: Once the Mail Centre office of SSP receives an invoice from the client , it categorizes the invoice by staff member . Then , the invoice is forwarded to the Administration Department ; this Department processes the Invoice ( a complex process ) and then puts all the invoices into a collection box . At 10 am every workday , the Data Entry office takes the invoices and enters all data in the SAP system , another complex process . Every hour the Mail Centre office reviews the system and forwards all new invoices for validation ; the Validation office executes the big process of validating invoices . At the beginning of every week , the Payment office executes the payment of every validate invoice , this is another big process . After the payment , all invoices are archived by the Registry office .
node_token_list: the Mail Centre office of SSP receives an invoice from the client
it categorizes the invoice by staff member

text: The process starts when the SO : Angebot / Auftrag receives a subsidiary order . The SO : Angebot / Auftrag prepares goods for shipment and then ships the goods , concurrently with preparing the goods and shipping them , the SO : Angebot / Auftrag prepares invoicing . In case the customer is subsidiary and the subsidiary relationship is not yet modeled , SO : Address - management adds parent company as invoicing address , then the SO : Angebot / Auftrag create the invoice . Otherwise if the customer is independent or the subsidiary relationship is already modeled in ERP , the SO : Angebot / Auftrag directly creates the invoice . Finally , the SO : Angebot / Auftrag sends the invoice .

text: In a certain company an Invoice process is started . First the Vendor is tried to be located into the SAP system of the company . If it is not possible to find it a sub-process to record this new Vendor is started . The request for this new Vendor Record starts with the filling of the new Vendor Master Record form . After this , the request is attached to the invoice and then putted in an internal outbox for new vendors . Before the request is finished it is classified in urgent and non-urgent invoices . Whenever the Invoice is urgent this Request has a maximum 24 hr window to be finished , while if it is non-urgent it has a 1 - 5 working days time to be done . If the Vendor is already in the system or the request for new Vendor Record has finished , its SAP number is then added to the invoice and the process continues . The invoices can be sorted in two ways : by amount and by vendor . The invoices are then entered in the SAP system and the process is finished .

text: The process starts when the admin office in SSP receives the invoice , the admin office then sorts the invoice per client , sorts the invoice per vendor , attaches invoice entry form to invoice , enters required info on the invoice entry form , and checks the completeness of the invoice after the client has completed the invoice . If the invoice is not completed a message is sent and the process finishes . Otherwise , if the invoice is complete , the admin office enters the info for the SLA and checks the priority . If the invoice has high priority , the admin office applies the red stamp on entry invoice . Afterwards , the admin office checks the invoice compliance . If the invoice is complete the admin office allocates invoice to DEO . Otherwise , if the invoice is not complete , the admin office can either send it to experience staff who should process the non-compliance invoice , call the client and request for information , or send a postal mail requesting the information complete ; in this case a reminder is sent to the client after 10 hours . Finally , when the missing information are obtained the admin office can allocate invoice to DEO .

text: The process starts with the business analyst collecting data and conducting business analysis regarding customer feedback , then the web designer integrates the design and decides where the customer feedback module should be placed . The business analyst waits until the design is complete , then she checks the design and provides feedback . If the design needs adjustment the web designer has to change the design and integrates the design and decides where the customer feedback module should be placed , again . If the design is OK . The PHP / HTML / CSS specialist integrates with the overall implementation , and then the tester tests the final website to make sure everything is going well . If the test is OK , the process ends , otherwise if the test is not ok the tester provides test results to the PHP / HTML / CSS specialist who adjusts according to the test results , and integrates the overall implementation , again .

text: In the process of adding a credit card for an internet purchase after choosing to pay with credit card the user has to put his credit card details , after that the billing address is checked . If it is incorrect the process goes back to the user so that it can be modified , if it is correct the process continues . Afterwards the user needs to click in the continue button to move forward . The Credit Card is then verified by the Credit Card Authority . The result is then checked and if it is validated the credit card is added , if not the addition is cancelled .

text: The process starts with a visitor filling out a registration - form . The availability of products and the credit rating is checked first . If the credit rating is higher than 9000 ( according to Schufa ) the registration is called unsuccessful . If not the interim customer dataset record is created . After this two sub-processes starts in parallel : Device provision and Register customer account at ISP nodes . Once these sub-processes are finished a welcome package is created and sent to the customer to alert them that the registration process was completed successfully .
